title: Ioannis Zelepos is a historian and cultural scientist. He studied General History, Byzantine Studies and Modern Greek Philology in Hamburg and Thessaloniki, completed his doctorate in Eastern European History at the Free University Berlin and completed his habilitation with Venia legendi for South-Eastern European History and Modern Greek Studies at the University of Vienna. His main research interests focus on Greece and Cyprus in the 19th and 20th centuries, the history of Greek migration, early modern religious cultures, the Enlightenment, identity discourses and nationalism in Southeast Europe
